course_title: Spec Topics: Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies: Feminist Persp.Visual Porn.
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Complete Topic: Feminist Perspectives on Visual Pornography)
(Feminists do not agree about the value and/or harm of pornography. Does it lead to more violence against women? Does it help create more freedom and pleasure for everyone? Should it be censored? Is censorship antifeminist? Students will be introduced to the major debates and discussions about pornography within feminist theory in the US. In keeping with the current scholarship, pornography will be viewed as a broad set of graphic materials pertaining not only to sex acts and gendered bodies, but also to racial and colonial imaginaries.
This course will also equip students with the rudimentary tools of visual analysis. What is the work of an image? How does it elicit visceral reactions of interest and/or repulsion? Is pornography a particular kind of image, or are all images pornographic to some extent?
The course materials range from academic essays to short stories, poetry, journalistic report, images, music videos and artwork.)
